DOC.HEAD: Islamist Demonstration in Algeria
DOC.TEXT: About 10,000 Islamic fundamentalists massed outside the National Assembly on Thursday to demonstrate for the ``dignity of Islamic women.'' The rally, attended by many women with their heads covered by the traditional scarf, was intended as a reply to a recent spontaneous demonstration of women at the site to protest Islamic extremism and demand the strict application of Algeria's Constitution calling for equality of the sexes. Loudspeakers broadcast verses from the Koran, the Moslem holy book, without interruption, while orderlies arranged the lines of demonstrators before the National Assembly as the police looked on but took no action. Meanwhile, the National Assembly adopted a ban on political demonstrtations at sites reserved for religious purposes. The fundamentalists who control most of the 8,000 Algerian mosques have increasingly used their sermons to denounce the ``Westernization'' of Algerian society and the decline of strict Islamic values.
